intro: Cassine schlechteriana, commonly known as the African whiteflame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The tree produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in panicles, attracting various pollinators. Its bark is thick and corky, providing some resistance to pests and diseases. Cassine schlechteriana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soils with adequate sunlight.
